flex-col items-end gap-2 whitespace-normal break-words text-start [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="o3-mini-high"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="154">Laravel provides two primary ways to interact with your database: <strong data-start="66" data-end="82">Eloquent ORM</strong> and the <strong data-start="91" data-end="108">Query Builder</strong>. Here’s a breakdown of their key differences:</p><h3 data-start="156" data-end="172">Eloquent ORM</h3><ul data-start="174" data-end="1022"><li data-start="174" data-end="428"><p data-start="176" data-end="428"><strong data-start="176" data-end="206">Object-Relational Mapping:</strong><br data-start="206" data-end="209">Eloquent implements the Active Record pattern. Each database table is represented by a model class, and each record becomes an instance of that model. This approach makes your code more expressive and object-oriented.</p></li><li data-start="430" data-end="638"><p data-start="432" data-end="638"><strong data-start="432" data-end="464">Relationships &amp; Conventions:</strong><br data-start="464" data-end="467">It allows you to define relationships (one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-many, etc.) directly in your model classes, handling joins and related queries behind the scenes.</p></li><li data-start="640" data-end="857"><p data-start="642" data-end="857"><strong data-start="642" data-end="672">Convenience &amp; Readability:</strong><br data-start="672" data-end="675">Eloquent simplifies common CRUD operations and automatically handles timestamps, soft deletes, and more. It’s great for rapid development and writing expressive, maintainable code.</p></li><li data-start="859" data-end="1022"><p data-start="861" data-end="1022"><strong data-start="861" data-end="874">Overhead:</strong><br data-start="874" data-end="877">Because it instantiates model objects and provides many additional features, Eloquent can be slower for extremely performance-critical queries.</p></li></ul><h3 data-start="1024" data-end="1041">Query Builder</h3><ul data-start="1043" data-end="1957"><li data-start="1043" data-end="1242"><p data-start="1045" data-end="1242"><strong data-start="1045" data-end="1066">Fluent Interface:</strong><br data-start="1066" data-end="1069">The Query Builder provides a fluent, chainable interface to construct SQL queries programmatically. It lets you build complex queries with ease without relying on raw SQL.</p></li><li data-start="1244" data-end="1500"><p data-start="1246" data-end="1500"><strong data-start="1246" data-end="1272">Flexibility &amp; Control:</strong><br data-start="1272" data-end="1275">It’s a lower-level tool that gives you more direct control over your queries. This can be beneficial when you need to optimize performance or write more complex queries that might not fit neatly into Eloquent’s conventions.</p></li><li data-start="1502" data-end="1691"><p data-start="1504" data-end="1691"><strong data-start="1504" data-end="1521">Return Types:</strong><br data-start="1521" data-end="1524">Instead of returning model instances, the Query Builder typically returns results as arrays or simple objects, which might be more lightweight for certain use cases.</p></li><li data-start="1693" data-end="1957"><p data-start="1695" data-end="1957"><strong data-start="1695" data-end="1716">Less Abstraction:</strong><br data-start="1716" data-end="1719">While you lose some of the object-oriented features of Eloquent (like model relationships and attribute casting), you gain more direct access to SQL and a slight performance benefit in scenarios where Eloquent’s overhead is unnecessary.</p></li></ul><h3 data-start="1959" data-end="1980">When to Use Which</h3><ul data-start="1982" data-end="2484"><li data-start="1982" data-end="2228"><p data-start="1984" data-end="2006"><strong data-start="1984" data-end="2004">Use Eloquent if:</strong></p><ul data-start="2009" data-end="2228"><li data-start="2009" data-end="2061">You favor an expressive, object-oriented syntax.</li><li data-start="2064" data-end="2142">Your application benefits from model relationships and other ORM features.</li><li data-start="2145" data-end="2228">You’re handling standard CRUD operations and want to write less boilerplate code.</li></ul></li><li data-start="2230" data-end="2484"><p data-start="2232" data-end="2259"><strong data-start="2232" data-end="2257">Use Query Builder if:</strong></p><ul data-start="2262" data-end="2484"><li data-start="2262" data-end="2316">You need fine-tuned control over your SQL queries.</li><li data-start="2319" data-end="2412">Performance is critical, and you want to avoid the extra overhead of model instantiation.</li><li data-start="2415" data-end="2484">Your query is too complex or doesn’t map cleanly to a single model.</li></ul></li></ul><p data-start="2486" data-end="2720" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">In summary, <strong data-start="2498" data-end="2510">Eloquent</strong> is ideal for rapid, expressive development using models and relationships, while the <strong data-start="2596" data-end="2613">Query Builder</strong> offers more granular control over SQL queries and can provide performance benefits for specific scenarios.</p></div></div></div></div><div class="mb-2 flex gap-3 empty:hidden -ml-2"><div class="items-center justify-start rounded-xl p-1 z-10 -mt-1 bg-token-main-surface-primary screen-arch:mt-1 text-start [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="o3-mini-high"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="301">Middleware in Laravel acts as a filtering layer between an incoming HTTP request and your application’s logic. It provides a convenient mechanism to inspect, modify, or reject requests before they reach your routes or controllers, and can also process responses before they're sent back to the client.</p><h3 data-start="303" data-end="334">Key Points about Middleware</h3><ul data-start="336" data-end="1091"><li data-start="336" data-end="636"><p data-start="338" data-end="636"><strong data-start="338" data-end="360">Request Filtering:</strong><br data-start="360" data-end="363">Middleware can perform tasks such as checking if a user is authenticated, logging requests, or even modifying request data. If a request doesn’t meet certain criteria (for example, a user isn’t logged in), the middleware can redirect the user or return an error response.</p></li><li data-start="638" data-end="841"><p data-start="640" data-end="841"><strong data-start="640" data-end="664">Response Processing:</strong><br data-start="664" data-end="667">After your application processes the request, middleware can also modify the response. This is useful for adding headers, formatting responses, or performing cleanup tasks.</p></li><li data-start="843" data-end="1091"><p data-start="845" data-end="1091"><strong data-start="845" data-end="866">Layered Approach:</strong><br data-start="866" data-end="869">Multiple middleware can be applied to a single route or globally, allowing you to stack filters that process the request sequentially. Each middleware passes the request to the next layer by calling the <code data-start="1074" data-end="1081">$next</code> callback.</p></li></ul><h3 data-start="1093" data-end="1127">Example of a Custom Middleware</h3><p data-start="1129" data-end="1264">Below is an example of a custom middleware that checks if the user meets a certain age requirement before accessing a particular route:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1266" data-end="1954"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-meta">&lt;?php</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">Illuminate</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Http</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Request</span>;

<span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">CheckAge</span>
</span>{
    <span class="hljs-comment">/**
     * Handle an incoming request.
     *
     * <span class="hljs-doctag">@param</span>  \Illuminate\Http\Request  $request
     * <span class="hljs-doctag">@param</span>  \Closure  $next
     * <span class="hljs-doctag">@return</span> mixed
     */</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">public</span> <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span> <span class="hljs-title">handle</span>(<span class="hljs-params">Request <span class="hljs-variable">$request</span>, <span class="hljs-built_in">Closure</span> <span class="hljs-variable">$next</span></span>)
    </span>{
        <span class="hljs-comment">// Check if the 'age' parameter is present and if it's less than 18.</span>
        <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> (<span class="hljs-variable">$request</span>-&gt;age &lt; <span class="hljs-number">18</span>) {
            <span class="hljs-comment">// If the user does not meet the age requirement, redirect them.</span>
            <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">redirect</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'home'</span>);
        }
        
        <span class="hljs-comment">// Otherwise, pass the request further into the application.</span>
        <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-variable">$next</span>(<span class="hljs-variable">$request</span>);
    }
}

dark:prose-invert dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="284">In Laravel, a <strong data-start="14" data-end="34">Service Provider</strong> is the central place where your application is bootstrapped. They are responsible for binding classes into the service container, registering event listeners, middleware, routes, and performing other bootstrapping tasks required by your application.</p><h3 data-start="286" data-end="300">Key Points</h3><ul data-start="302" data-end="906"><li data-start="302" data-end="472"><p data-start="304" data-end="472"><strong data-start="304" data-end="322">Bootstrapping:</strong><br data-start="322" data-end="325">Service providers are loaded on every request, which allows you to set up application services and configurations early in the request lifecycle.</p></li><li data-start="474" data-end="906"><p data-start="476" data-end="508"><strong data-start="476" data-end="506">Register vs. Boot Methods:</strong></p><ul data-start="511" data-end="906"><li data-start="511" data-end="698"><strong data-start="513" data-end="528">register():</strong> This method is used to bind classes or services into the service container. No other services have been loaded at this point, so you should not depend on other services.</li><li data-start="701" data-end="906"><strong data-start="703" data-end="714">boot():</strong> This method is called after all other service providers have been registered. It is used for tasks that require other services to be available, such as event listeners or route registrations.</li></ul></li></ul><h3 data-start="908" data-end="955">Example: Creating a Custom Service Provider</h3><p data-start="957" data-end="1125">Suppose you have a service class that handles some business logic, for instance, <code data-start="1038" data-end="1049">MyService</code>. You want to register this service as a singleton in the service container.</p><ol data-start="1127" data-end="3136"><li data-start="1127" data-end="1278"><p data-start="1130" data-end="1164"><strong data-start="1130" data-end="1164">Generate the Service Provider:</strong></p><p data-start="1169" data-end="1213">You can create a new provider using Artisan:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1217" data-end="1278"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">bash</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-bash"><span>php artisan make:provider MyServiceProvider
</span></code></div></div></pre></li><li data-start="1280" data-end="2237"><p data-start="1283" data-end="1318"><strong data-start="1283" data-end="1318">Implement the Service Provider:</strong></p><p data-start="1323" data-end="1413">Open the generated file at <code data-start="1350" data-end="1387">app/Providers/MyServiceProvider.php</code> and modify it as follows:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1418" data-end="2237"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-meta">&lt;?php</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">namespace</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">App</span>\<span class="hljs-title class_">Providers</span>;

<span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">Illuminate</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Support</span>\<span class="hljs-title">ServiceProvider</span>;
<span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">App</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Services</span>\<span class="hljs-title">MyService</span>;

<span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">MyServiceProvider</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">extends</span> <span class="hljs-title">ServiceProvider</span>
</span>{
    <span class="hljs-comment">/**
     * Register any application services.
     *
     * <span class="hljs-doctag">@return</span> void
     */</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">public</span> <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span> <span class="hljs-title">register</span>(<span class="hljs-params"></span>)
    </span>{
        <span class="hljs-comment">// Binding MyService as a singleton in the container.</span>
        <span class="hljs-variable language_">$this</span>-&gt;app-&gt;<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">singleton</span>(<span class="hljs-title class_">MyService</span>::<span class="hljs-variable language_">class</span>, function (<span class="hljs-variable">$app</span>) {
            <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">new</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">MyService</span>();
        });
    }

    <span class="hljs-comment">/**
     * Bootstrap any application services.
     *
     * <span class="hljs-doctag">@return</span> void
     */</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">public</span> <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span> <span class="hljs-title">boot</span>(<span class="hljs-params"></span>)
    </span>{
        <span class="hljs-comment">// Here you can perform actions after all services have been registered.</span>
        <span class="hljs-comment">// For example, registering events or routes.</span>
    }
}
</span></code></div></div></pre></li><li data-start="2239" data-end="2477"><p data-start="2242" data-end="2276"><strong data-start="2242" data-end="2276">Register the Service Provider:</strong></p><p data-start="2281" data-end="2348">Add your new provider to the <code data-start="2310" data-end="2321">providers</code> array in <code data-start="2331" data-end="2347">config/app.php</code>:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="2353" data-end="2477"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-string">'providers'</span> =&gt; [
    <span class="hljs-comment">// Other Service Providers...</span>

    <span class="hljs-title class_">App\Providers\MyServiceProvider</span>::<span class="hljs-variable language_">class</span>,
],
</span></code></div></div></pre></li><li data-start="2479" data-end="3136"><p data-start="2482" data-end="2504"><strong data-start="2482" data-end="2504">Using the Service:</strong></p><p data-start="2509" data-end="2597">Now, you can inject <code data-start="2529" data-end="2540">MyService</code> into any controller or class using dependency injection:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="2602" data-end="3136"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-meta">&lt;?php</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">namespace</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">App</span>\<span class="hljs-title class_">Http</span>\<span class="hljs-title class_">Controllers</span>;

<span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">App</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Services</span>\<span class="hljs-title">MyService</span>;
<span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">Illuminate</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Http</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Request</span>;

<span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">MyController</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">extends</span> <span class="hljs-title">Controller</span>
</span>{
    <span class="hljs-keyword">protected</span> <span class="hljs-variable">$myService</span>;

    <span class="hljs-keyword">public</span> <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span> <span class="hljs-title">__construct</span>(<span class="hljs-params">MyService <span class="hljs-variable">$myService</span></span>)
    </span>{
        <span class="hljs-variable language_">$this</span>-&gt;myService = <span class="hljs-variable">$myService</span>;
    }

    <span class="hljs-keyword">public</span> <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span> <span class="hljs-title">index</span>(<span class="hljs-params"></span>)
    </span>{
        <span class="hljs-comment">// Use $this-&gt;myService to perform tasks</span>
        <span class="hljs-variable">$result</span> = <span class="hljs-variable language_">$this</span>-&gt;myService-&gt;<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">performAction</span>();

        <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">view</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'welcome'</span>, <span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">compact</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'result'</span>));
    }
}
</span></code></div></div></pre></li></ol><h3 data-start="3138" data-end="3149">Summary</h3><ul data-start="3151" data-end="3518"><li data-start="3151" data-end="3237"><strong data-start="3153" data-end="3174">Service Providers</strong> are the foundation for bootstrapping your Laravel application.</li><li data-start="3238" data-end="3366">They use the <code data-start="3253" data-end="3265">register()</code> method for binding services into the container and <code data-start="3317" data-end="3325">boot()</code> for actions that require those services.</li><li data-start="3367" data-end="3518">The provided example shows how to create a custom service provider to register a singleton service, and then how to use that service in a controller.</li></ul><p data-start="3520" data-end="3691" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">This approach keeps your application's dependencies organized and ensures that your services are only instantiated once, empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="224">Service providers in Laravel are essentially the central place to configure and bootstrap your application. They play a crucial role in setting up everything your app needs to run. Here’s what service providers are used for:</p><h3 data-start="226" data-end="259">Key Uses of Service Providers</h3><ul data-start="261" data-end="1267"><li data-start="261" data-end="537"><p data-start="263" data-end="537"><strong data-start="263" data-end="298">Dependency Injection &amp; Binding:</strong><br data-start="298" data-end="301">They bind classes or interfaces into Laravel's service container, which makes it easy to manage dependencies throughout your application. For example, you can register a service as a singleton or bind an interface to a concrete class.</p></li><li data-start="539" data-end="805"><p data-start="541" data-end="805"><strong data-start="541" data-end="582">Bootstrapping Application Components:</strong><br data-start="582" data-end="585">Service providers initialize essential components, such as event listeners, middleware, routes, or even external libraries. This ensures that these elements are set up before your application handles incoming requests.</p></li><li data-start="807" data-end="1055"><p data-start="809" data-end="1055"><strong data-start="809" data-end="839">Centralized Configuration:</strong><br data-start="839" data-end="842">By using service providers, you consolidate configuration and setup logic in one place. This makes your codebase more organized and maintainable, as you separate the bootstrapping logic from your business logic.</p></li><li data-start="1057" data-end="1267"><p data-start="1059" data-end="1267"><strong data-start="1059" data-end="1077">Extensibility:</strong><br data-start="1077" data-end="1080">They allow you to extend or override default behaviors in Laravel. Many Laravel packages come with their own service providers to register additional functionality with the application.</p></li></ul><h3 data-start="1269" data-end="1302">Example of a Service Provider</h3><p data-start="1304" data-end="1476">Consider a custom service that performs a specific task, say <code data-start="1365" data-end="1376">MyService</code>. dark:prose-invert dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="325">Service providers in Laravel are the central mechanism for bootstrapping your application’s various services and components. They allow you to bind classes or interfaces into the service container, register event listeners, middleware, routes, and perform any necessary configuration during the application’s startup process.</p><h3 data-start="327" data-end="361">Key Roles of Service Providers</h3><ul data-start="363" data-end="1147"><li data-start="363" data-end="616"><p data-start="365" data-end="616"><strong data-start="365" data-end="388">Dependency Binding:</strong><br data-start="388" data-end="391">They register and configure services (like repositories, custom libraries, or helper classes) by binding them into Laravel’s service container. This makes them available for dependency injection throughout your application.</p></li><li data-start="618" data-end="950"><p data-start="620" data-end="950"><strong data-start="620" data-end="638">Bootstrapping:</strong><br data-start="638" data-end="641">Service providers run during the application's boot process. The <code data-start="708" data-end="720">register()</code> method is used to bind services, while the <code data-start="764" data-end="772">boot()</code> method is called after all providers are registered, which allows you to perform tasks that rely on other services being available (e.g., event listeners, route configurations).</p></li><li data-start="952" data-end="1147"><p data-start="954" data-end="1147"><strong data-start="954" data-end="972">Extensibility:</strong><br data-start="972" data-end="975">They enable you to extend or override the default behaviors of Laravel. Many packages come with their own service providers to seamlessly integrate with your application.</p></li></ul><h3 data-start="1149" data-end="1196">Example: Creating a Custom Service Provider</h3><p data-start="1198" data-end="1394">Imagine you have a service class called <code data-start="1238" data-end="1249">MyService</code> that encapsulates specific business logic. You can create and register a service provider to make <code data-start="1348" data-end="1359">MyService</code> available across your application.</p><ol data-start="1396" data-end="3242"><li data-start="1396" data-end="1527"><p data-start="1399" data-end="1433"><strong data-start="1399" data-end="1433">Generate the Service Provider:</strong></p><p data-start="1438" data-end="1462">Run the Artisan command:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1466" data-end="1527"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative data-end="3280">Service providers</strong> are essential for initializing and configuring your Laravel application.</li><li data-start="3354" data-end="3444">They bind services into the service container, making them available throughout the app.</li><li data-start="3445" data-end="3571">They help organize your bootstrapping logic—separating configuration from business logic and keeping your code maintainable.</li><li data-start="3572" data-end="3718">By leveraging service providers, you ensure that your application components are properly loaded and ready for use before handling any requests.</li></ul><p data-start="3720" data-end="3879" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">This architecture makes Laravel highly flexible and modular, allowing you to manage dependencies and dark:prose-invert dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="243">In Laravel, Eloquent makes it easy to define and work with relationships between different models. These relationships allow you to retrieve related data with minimal code. Here are a couple of common relationship examples and how to use them.</p><hr data-start="245" data-end="248"><h2 data-start="250" data-end="277">One-to-Many Relationship</h2><p data-start="279" data-end="408">A <strong data-start="281" data-end="296">one-to-many</strong> relationship is used when one model owns many related models. For instance, a <strong data-start="375" data-end="383">User</strong> can have many <strong data-start="398" data-end="407">Posts</strong>.</p><h3 data-start="410" data-end="439">Defining the Relationship</h3><p data-start="441" data-end="480"><strong data-start="441" data-end="480">User Model (<code data-start="455" data-end="476">app/Models/User.php</code>):</strong></p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="482" data-end="711"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-meta">&lt;?php</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">namespace</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">App</span>\<span class="hljs-title class_">Models</span>;

<span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">Illuminate</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Database</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Eloquent</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Model</span>;

<span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">User</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">extends</span> <span class="hljs-title">Model</span>
</span>{
    <span class="hljs-comment">// A user can have many posts.</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">public</span> <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span> <span class="hljs-title">posts</span>(<span class="hljs-params"></span>)
    </span>{
        <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-variable language_">$this</span>-&gt;<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">hasMany</span>(<span class="hljs-title class_">Post</span>::<span class="hljs-variable language_">class</span>);
    }
}
</span></code></div></div></pre><p data-start="713" data-end="752"><strong data-start="713" data-end="752">Post Model (<code data-start="727" data-end="748">app/Models/Post.php</code>):</strong></p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="754" data-end="982"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-meta">&lt;?php</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">namespace</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">App</span>\<span class="hljs-title class_">Models</span>;

<span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">Illuminate</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Database</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Eloquent</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Model</span>;

<span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">Post</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">extends</span> <span class="hljs-title">Model</span>

    </span>{

    }
}
</span></code></div></div></pre><h3 data-start="984" data-end="1010">Using the Relationship</h3><p data-start="1012" data-end="1070">You can retrieve a user's posts or a post's author easily:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1072" data-end="1283"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-comment">// Retrieve a user and their posts</span>

<span class="hljs-variable">$posts</span> = <span class="hljs-variable">$user</span>-&gt;posts; <span class="hljs-comment">// Collection of Post models</span>

<span class="hljs-comment">// Retrieve a post and its associated user</span>
<span class="hljs-variable">$post</span> = <span class="hljs-title class_">Post</span>::<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">find</span>(<span class="hljs-number">10</span>);
<span class="hljs-variable">$author</span> = <span class="hljs-variable">$post</span>-&gt;user;
</span></code></div></div></pre><hr data-start="1285" data-end="1288"><h2 data-start="1290" data-end="1318">Many-to-Many Relationship</h2><p data-start="1320" data-end="1567">A <strong data-start="1322" data-end="1338">many-to-many</strong> relationship is used when both models can relate to each other. For example, a <strong data-start="1418" data-end="1426">User</strong> can have many <strong data-start="1441" data-end="1450">Roles</strong>, and a <strong data-start="1458" data-end="1466">Role</strong> can belong to many <strong data-start="1486" data-end="1495">Users</strong>. This relationship requires a pivot table (commonly named <code data-start="1554" data-end="1565">role_user</code>).</p><h3 data-start="1569" data-end="1598">Defining the Relationship</h3><p data-start="1600" data-end="1639"><strong data-start="1600" data-end="1639">User Model (<code data-start="1614" data-end="1635">app/Models/User.php</code>):</strong></p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1641" data-end="1876"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-meta">&lt;?php</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">namespace</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">App</span>\<span class="hljs-title class_">Models</span>;

<span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">Illuminate</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Database</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Eloquent</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Model</span>;

<span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">User</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">extends</span> <span class="hljs-title">Model</span>
</span>{
    <span class="hljs-comment">// A user can have many roles.</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">public</span> <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span> <span class="hljs-title">roles</span>(<span class="hljs-params"></span>)
    </span>{
        <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-variable language_">$this</span>-&gt;<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">belongsToMany</span>(<span class="hljs-title class_">Role</span>::<span class="hljs-variable language_">class</span>);
    }
}
</span></code></div></div></pre><p data-start="1878" data-end="1917"><strong data-start="1878" data-end="1917">Role Model (<code data-start="1892" data-end="1913">app/Models/Role.php</code>):</strong></p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1919" data-end="2159"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-meta">&lt;?php</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">namespace</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">App</span>\<span class="hljs-title class_">Models</span>;

<span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">Illuminate</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Database</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Eloquent</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Model</span>;

<span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">Role</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">extends</span> <span class="hljs-title">Model</span>
</span>{
    <span class="hljs-comment">// A role can belong to many users.</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">public</span> <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span> <span class="hljs-title">users</span>(<span class="hljs-params"></span>)
    </span>{
        <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-variable language_">$this</span>-&gt;<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">belongsToMany</span>(<span class="hljs-title class_">User</span>::<span class="hljs-variable language_">class</span>);
    }
}
</span></code></div></div></pre><h3 data-start="2161" data-end="2187">Using the Relationship</h3><p data-start="2189" data-end="2261">You can attach roles to a user or retrieve roles associated with a user:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="2263" data-end="2615"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-comment">// Retrieve a user and their roles</span>
<span class="hljs-variable">$user</span> = <span class="hljs-title class_">User</span>::<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">find</span>(<span class="hljs-number">1</span>);
<span class="hljs-variable">$roles</span> = <span class="hljs-variable">$user</span>-&gt;roles; <span class="hljs-comment">// Collection of Role models</span>

<span class="hljs-comment">// Attach a role to a user (using the role's ID)</span>
<span class="hljs-variable">$user</span>-&gt;<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">roles</span>()-&gt;<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">attach</span>(<span class="hljs-number">3</span>);

<span class="hljs-comment">// Detach a role from a user</span>
<span class="hljs-variable">$user</span>-&gt;<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">roles</span>()-&gt;<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">detach</span>(<span class="hljs-number">3</span>);

<span class="hljs-comment">// Retrieve all users with a specific role</span>
<span class="hljs-variable">$role</span> = <span class="hljs-title class_">Role</span>::<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">find</span>(<span class="hljs-number">2</span>);
<span class="hljs-variable">$usersWithRole</span> = <span class="hljs-variable">$role</span>-&gt;users;
</span></code></div></div></pre><hr data-start="2617" data-end="2620"><h2 data-start="2622" data-end="2632">Summary</h2><ul data-start="2634" data-end="3078"><li data-start="2634" data-end="2850"><p data-start="2636" data-end="2654"><strong data-start="2636" data-end="2652">One-to-Many:</strong></p><ul data-start="2657" data-end="2850"><li data-start="2657" data-end="2748"><em data-start="2659" data-end="2672">Definition:</em> One model (e.g., User) owns many instances of another model (e.g., Post).</li><li data-start="2751" data-end="2850"><em data-start="2753" data-end="2761">Usage:</em> <code data-start="2762" data-end="2776">$user-&gt;posts</code> returns a collection of posts; <code data-start="2808" data-end="2821">$post-&gt;user</code> returns the associated user.</li></ul></li><li data-start="2852" data-end="3078"><p data-start="2854" data-end="2873"><strong data-start="2854" data-end="2871">Many-to-Many:</strong></p><ul data-start="2876" data-end="3078"><li data-start="2876" data-end="2975"><em data-start="2878" data-end="2891">Definition:</em> Both models (e.g., User and Role) relate to each other and require a pivot table.</li><li data-start="2978" data-end="3078"><em data-start="2980" data-end="2988">Usage:</em> <code data-start="2989" data-end="3003">$user-&gt;roles</code> returns a collection of roles; you can attach/detach roles to/from a user.</li></ul></li></ul><p data-start="3080" data-end="3289" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">These relationships in Laravel provide an expressive and efficient way to work with your database. dark:prose-invert dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="198">CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery) tokens are security measures used to protect your application from malicious requests. In Laravel, CSRF protection is built into the framework and works as follows:</p><h3 data-start="200" data-end="225">What Is a CSRF Token?</h3><ul data-start="227" data-end="680"><li data-start="227" data-end="446"><p data-start="229" data-end="446"><strong data-start="229" data-end="241">Purpose:</strong><br data-start="241" data-end="244">A CSRF token is a unique, secret value generated for each active user session. It helps verify that requests made to your application originate from your own site and not from a malicious third-party.</p></li><li data-start="448" data-end="680"><p data-start="450" data-end="680"><strong data-start="450" data-end="475">Protection Mechanism:</strong><br data-start="475" data-end="478">When a user submits a form or makes a state-changing request (e.g., POST, PUT, DELETE), Laravel checks for a matching CSRF token. If the token is missing or invalid, the framework rejects the request.</p></li></ul><h3 data-start="682" data-end="717">How Laravel Handles CSRF Tokens</h3><ul data-start="719" data-end="1104"><li data-start="719" data-end="919"><p data-start="721" data-end="919"><strong data-start="721" data-end="736">Middleware:</strong><br data-start="736" data-end="739">Laravel automatically applies the <code data-start="775" data-end="792">VerifyCsrfToken</code> middleware to your web routes. This middleware is responsible for checking the CSRF token on each request that modifies state.</p></li><li data-start="921" data-end="1104"><p data-start="923" data-end="1104"><strong data-start="923" data-end="954">Automatic Token Generation:</strong><br data-start="954" data-end="957">The token is automatically generated and stored in the user's session. You can access it in your Blade templates using the helper <code data-start="1089" data-end="1103">csrf_token()</code>.</p></li></ul><h3 data-start="1106" data-end="1136">Using CSRF Tokens in Forms</h3><p data-start="1138" data-end="1291">When creating forms in Laravel, you include the CSRF token using the Blade directive <code data-start="1223" data-end="1230">@csrf</code>. This directive injects a hidden input field with the token.</p><p data-start="1293" data-end="1305"><strong data-start="1293" data-end="1305">Example:</strong></p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1307" data-end="1486"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">blade</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-blade"><span>&lt;form action="/submit" method="POST"&gt;
    @csrf
    &lt;!-- Your form fields --&gt;
    &lt;input type="text" name="example"&gt;
    &lt;button type="submit"&gt;Submit&lt;/button&gt;
&lt;/form&gt;
</span></code></div></div></pre><h3 data-start="1488" data-end="1520">CSRF Tokens in AJAX Requests</h3><p data-start="1522" data-end="1717">For AJAX requests, you need to ensure that the CSRF token is sent along with the request. You can embed the token in a meta tag and configure your JavaScript to include it in the request headers.</p><p data-start="1719" data-end="1746"><strong data-start="1719" data-end="1746">Example </span></code></div></div></pre><p data-start="429" data-end="537">This command generates a model file in the <code data-start="472" data-end="484">app/Models</code> directory (or in <code data-start="502" data-end="508">app/</code> for older Laravel versions).</p><hr data-start="539" data-end="542"><h2 data-start="544" data-end="566">2. Defining a Model</h2><p data-start="568" data-end="739">In your model, you can define which table it uses (if different from the default naming convention), set mass assignable attributes, and define relationships. For example:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="741" data-end="1127"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-meta">&lt;?php</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">namespace</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">App</span>\<span class="hljs-title class_">Models</span>;

<span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">Illuminate</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Database</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Eloquent</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Model</span>;

<span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">User</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">extends</span> <span class="hljs-title">Model</span>
</span>{
    <span class="hljs-comment">// Define the fillable attributes to allow mass assignment.</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">protected</span> <span class="hljs-variable">$fillable</span> = [<span class="hljs-string">'name'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'email'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'password'</span>];

    <span class="hljs-comment">// Define a one-to-many relationship: a user can have many posts.</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">public</span> <span class="hljs-function"><span class="hljs-keyword">function</span> <span class="hljs-title">posts</span>(<span class="hljs-params"></span>)
    </span>{
        <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> <span class="hljs-variable language_">$this</span>-&gt;<span class="hljs-title function_ invoke__">hasMany</span>(<span class="hljs-title class_">Post</span>::<span class="hljs-variable language_">class</span>);
    }
}
</span></code></div></div></pre><p data-start="1129" data-end="1167">Similarly, if you have a <code data-start="1154" data-end="1160">Post</code> model:</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1169" data-end="1549"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-meta">&lt;?php</span>

<span class="hljs-keyword">namespace</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">App</span>\<span class="hljs-title class_">Models</span>;

<span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">Illuminate</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Database</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Eloquent</span>\<span class="hljs-title">Model</span>;

<span class="hljs-class"><span class="hljs-keyword">class</span> <span class="hljs-title">Post</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">extends</span> <span class="hljs-title">Model</span>
</span>{
    <span class="hljs-comment">// Define the attributes that are mass assignable.</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">protected</span> <span class="hljs-variable">$fillable</span> = [<span class="hljs-string">'title'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'body'</span>, <span class="hljs-string">'user_id'</span>];

    <span class="hljs-comment">// Define the inverse of the relationship: a post belongs to a user.</span>

dark:prose-invert dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="405">Imagine your Laravel app is like a quirky office party. When something big happens—say, a new employee (or user) shows up—an announcement (event) is made. Now, in every party, there's that one enthusiastic coworker (the event listener) who hears the news and immediately jumps into action, whether it's sending a welcome email, preparing a celebratory cake, or even just gossiping around the water cooler.</p><h3 data-start="407" data-end="434">How It Works in Laravel</h3><ol data-start="436" data-end="863"><li data-start="436" data-end="609"><p data-start="439" data-end="609"><strong data-start="439" data-end="449">Event:</strong><br data-start="449" data-end="452">The event is like the office megaphone that shouts, "Hey, we’ve got a new team member!" It’s fired when something significant happens in your application.</p></li><li data-start="611" data-end="863"><p data-start="614" data-end="863"><strong data-start="614" data-end="627">Listener:</strong><br data-start="627" data-end="630">The listener is our eager coworker who hears the announcement and takes care of all the follow-up actions. It’s decoupled from the event itself, meaning the event doesn't need to know what happens next—it just broadcasts the news.</p></li></ol><h3 data-start="865" data-end="892">A Funny Example in Code</h3><h4 data-start="894" data-end="939">Step 1: Define an Event (UserRegistered)</h4><p data-start="941" data-end="1037">This event is fired when a new user is registered. Think of it as the announcement at the party.</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1039" data-end="1350"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">php</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-php"><span><span class="hljs-keyword">namespace</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">App</span>\<span class="hljs-title class_">Events</span>;

    </span>{
        <span class="hljs-variable language_">$this</span>-&gt;user = <span class="hljs-variable">$user</span>;

data-end="2366">Events</strong> are like the office announcements that broadcast important news.</li><li data-start="2432" data-end="2569"><strong data-start="2434" data-end="2447">Listeners</strong> are like those super-energetic coworkers who rush off to handle the follow-up tasks (sending emails, logging info, etc.).</li><li data-start="2570" data-end="2721">This decoupling keeps your code clean and ensures that one part of your application doesn't need to worry about all the details of what happens next.</li></ul><p data-start="2723" data-end="2909" data-is-last-node="" data-is-only-node="">So, in the world of Laravel, event listeners turn every big announcement into a well-coordinated office party where everything runs smoothly—and there's always a touch of humor text-start [.text-message+&amp;]:mt-5" data-message-model-slug="o3-mini-high"><div class="flex w-full flex-col gap-1 empty:hidden first:pt-[3px]"><div class="markdown prose w-full break-words dark:prose-invert dark"><p data-start="0" data-end="388">Imagine you're at a theme park with a super long roller coaster line. Instead of making everyone wait in line, the park gives you a fast-pass so you can enjoy other attractions while your turn comes up. In Laravel, a <strong data-start="217" data-end="226">queue</strong> works similarly: it lets you postpone time-consuming tasks (like sending emails or processing images) so your users don’t have to wait for those tasks to finish.</p><hr data-start="390" data-end="393"><h3 data-start="395" data-end="409">Key Points</h3><ul data-start="411" data-end="1141"><li data-start="411" data-end="671"><p data-start="413" data-end="671"><strong data-start="413" data-end="441">Asynchronous Processing:</strong><br data-start="441" data-end="444">Queues allow you to defer tasks to a background process, keeping your application responsive. For example, instead of making a user wait for an email to be sent, you push that task to a queue and let a worker handle it later.</p></li><li data-start="673" data-end="837"><p data-start="675" data-end="837"><strong data-start="675" data-end="691">Job Classes:</strong><br data-start="691" data-end="694">In Laravel, you define tasks as Job classes. Each job represents a specific task, like processing an uploaded file or sending a notification.</p></li><li data-start="839" data-end="968"><p data-start="841" data-end="968"><strong data-start="841" data-end="859">Queue Workers:</strong><br data-start="859" data-end="862">A queue worker is a long-running process that listens for jobs on a queue and processes them one by one.</p></li><li data-start="970" data-end="1141"><p data-start="972" data-end="1141"><strong data-start="972" data-end="999">Multiple Queue Drivers:</strong><br data-start="999" data-end="1002">Laravel supports different backends for queues (like database, Redis, Amazon SQS, etc.), so you can choose one that best fits your needs.</p></li></ul><hr data-start="1143" data-end="1146"><h3 data-start="1148" data-end="1165">A Fun Example</h3><ol data-start="1167" data-end="2921"><li data-start="1167" data-end="1389"><p data-start="1170" data-end="1329"><strong data-start="1170" data-end="1187">Create a Job:</strong><br data-start="1187" data-end="1190">Imagine you need to send a welcome email when a user registers. Instead of sending the email immediately, you create a job to handle it.</p><pre class="!overflow-visible" data-start="1334" data-end="1389"><div class="contain-inline-size rounded-md border-[0.5px] border-token-border-medium relative bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-gray-950"><div class="flex items-center text-token-text-secondary px-4 py-2 text-xs font-sans justify-between rounded-t-[5px] h-9 bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary select-none">bash</div><div class="sticky top-9 md:top-[5.75rem]"><div class="absolute bottom-0 right-2 flex h-9 items-center"><div class="flex items-center rounded bg-token-sidebar-surface-primary px-2 font-sans text-xs text-token-text-secondary dark:bg-token-main-surface-secondary"><span class="" data-state="closed"><button class="flex gap-1 items-center select-none px-4 py-1" aria-label="Copy"><svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon-xs"><path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M7 5C7 3.34315 8.34315 2 10 2H19C20.6569 2 22 3.34315 22 5V14C22 15.6569 20.6569 17 19 17H17V19C17 20.6569 15.6569 22 14 22H5C3.34315 22 2 20.6569 2 19V10C2 8.34315 3.34315 7 5 7H7V5ZM9 7H14C15.6569 7 17 8.34315 17 10V15H19C19.5523 15 20 14.5523 20 14V5C20 4.44772 19.5523 4 19 4H10C9.44772 4 9 4.44772 9 5V7ZM5 9C4.44772 9 4 9.44772 4 10V19C4 19.5523 4.44772 20 5 20H14C14.5523 20 15 19.5523 15 19V10C15 9.44772 14.5523 9 14 9H5Z" fill="currentColor"></path></svg>Copy</button></span></div></div></div><div class="overflow-y-auto p-4" dir="ltr"><code class="!whitespace-pre language-bash"><span>php artisan make:job SendWelcomeEmail

</span></code></div></div></pre><p data-start="2820" data-end="2921">This worker acts like the ride operator, taking jobs (fast-passes) and processing them one at a time.</p></li></ol><hr Classes that encapsulate a task and implement the <code data-start="3081" data-end="3094">ShouldQueue</code> interface.</li><li data-start="3106" data-end="3173"><strong data-start="3108"
